title: Allow cristianoliveira to run nixos-rebuild without password
description:
Goal: allow user cristianoliveira to run nixos-rebuild without password via Nix-managed sudoers.

Context:
- NixOS host config is defined in nix/nixos/configuration.nix; user is in wheel but no sudoers override for nixos-rebuild.
- Rebuild helper nix/rebuild.sh uses sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake /home/cristianoliveira/.dotfiles/nix#nixos (line 33).
- There is an existing darwin example that writes a sudoers.d entry: nix/osx/configuration.nix:69; use similar pattern for NixOS.

Plan:
1) Add a Nix option (security.sudo.extraRules or environment.etc.sudoers.d/nixos-rebuild.text) granting cristianoliveira NOPASSWD for /run/current-system/sw/bin/nixos-rebuild (and needed flags) to match nix/rebuild.sh.
2) Scope rule narrowly; document the intent near the rule (reference nix/rebuild.sh).
3) Validate after rebuild with sudo -n nixos-rebuild --version or a dry-run/test invocation.
4) If any docs mention rebuild workflow (nix/README.md or nix/nixos/notes.txt), add a note about passwordless rebuild capability.

Deliverable: merged config change plus .beads/issues.jsonl updated with this issue status.
